summary: This bill, the Deter PRC Aggression Against Taiwan Act, aims to develop economic tools to deter aggression by the People's Republic of China (PRC) against Taiwan. It directs the establishment of a PRC Sanctions Task Force to identify entities that could be subject to sanctions if the PRC takes actions against Taiwan. The task force is to assess existing sanctions programs, develop new authorities, analyze economic consequences, coordinate with allies, and recommend how to best target sanctions. Annual reports to Congress are required detailing findings and recommendations.
